title: Customizing Speech Recognition Model with Large Language Model Feedback
author: Shaoshi Ling (Microsoft Core AI), Guoli Ye (Microsoft Core AI), ...
relevance_why: The paper discusses reinforcement learning frameworks that utilize feedback from Large Language Models (LLMs) for improving transcription quality in Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR), which aligns with Dr. Liu's interests in audio and speech processing.
background: This research focuses on enhancing Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR) systems through a reinforcement learning approach that incorporates feedback from Large Language Models for better transcription accuracy, particularly for rare named entities in diverse domains.
contribution: This paper introduces a reinforcement learning framework utilizing Large Language Model feedback to adapt Automatic Speech Recognition systems, achieving a 21% improvement in entity word error rate over self-training approaches.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods like self-training primarily relied on pseudo-labels generated by the ASR models and their confidence scores, which can be unreliable.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work leverages LLMs as reward models to provide evaluation scores directly, improving the quality of ASR hypotheses without needing separate confidence estimates.

key_innovation: The unique aspect of this method is its integration of contextual information from LLMs into the ASR training process, facilitating a more nuanced adaptation to domain changes.
real_world_impact: The framework is expected to improve real-world ASR applications, particularly in scenarios where domain mismatches and rare named entities are prevalent, thus enhancing user experience and accessibility.

new_terms.entity word error rate (EWER): **Entity word error rate (EWER)** is a metric used to evaluate the accuracy of recognition for specific named entities within a set of transcriptions, focusing on their proper identification and transcription.
